titleStmt.title: An answer to the unjust complaints of William Best and of such other as have subscribed thereunto. Also an answer to Mr. Iohn Davenport, touching his report of some passages, his allegations of scripture against the baptising of some kind of infants, his protestation about the publishing of his writings. By Iohn Paget.
titleStmt.author: Paget, John, d. 1640.

titleStmt.title: An answer to the unjust complaints of William Best and of such other as have subscribed thereunto. Also an answer to Mr. Iohn Davenport, touching his report of some passages, his allegations of scripture against the baptising of some kind of infants, his protestation about the publishing of his writings. By Iohn Paget.
titleStmt.author: Paget, John, d. 1640.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Fredericksz Stam, dwelling by the South-Church, at the signe of the Hope,

notesStmt.note: The roman numeral date in the imprint is made with turned C's.
Answers: Davenport, John. A just complaint against an unjust doer. (STC 6311).
Considerable print show-through; many pages marked and stained. Margins cropped.
Reproduction of the original in Dr. Williams's Library.
